definition: to discuss/to comment/to criticize/to judge/to choose (by public appraisal)
to break/to snap/to cut off/to give up or abstain from sth/to judge/(usu. used in the negative) absolutely/definitely/decidedly

sentences.english: Too often we judge people on too little information.
sentences.chinese: 我们时常通过一点点信息来评断一个人。

sentences.english: What I am looking for, some criterion judging between them.
sentences.chinese: 我正在找寻两者之间的评断标准。

sentences.english: Learn the art of empathy. Too often we judge people on too little information.
sentences.chinese: 我们时常通过一点点信息来评断一个人。

sentences.english: Obert: We'd like to agree, but one year would be too early to judge.
sentences.chinese: 我们很想同意，但以一年的时间来评断，似乎太早了。

sentences.english: Maybe we just have a look at the TV play, then we can judge by ourselves.
sentences.chinese: 或许我们自己看一下电视剧，就自然会有评断了。

sentences.english: Lucy: Maybe we just have a look at the TV play, then we can judge by ourselves.
sentences.chinese: 或许我们自己看一下电视剧，就自然会有评断了。

definition: to make a definitive judgment/to come to a firm conclusion
to jump to an unfounded conclusion
don't pass judgment on a person's life until the lid is on the coffin (idiom)
to offer an opinion/to comment (on the issue)/to have a say (in the matter)
